project.teaser: The ONEPlanET project aims to develop a common nexus modelling framework to simulate and evaluate pathways to define a more sustainable future in Africa through the deployment of renewable energy infrastructure. In this way, it will be possible to stimulate a green energy...
project.objective: The ONEPlanET project aims to develop a common nexus modelling framework to simulate and evaluate pathways to define a more sustainable future in Africa through the deployment of renewable energy infrastructure. In this way, it will be possible to stimulate a green energy transition in the continent as well as a decarbonization of existing energy plants. The ONEPlanET model will be tailored to the needs of different stakeholders and end-users (public and private actors, policy and decision-makers, experts, and citizens) and will be totally open source to stimulate its future upgrades. The model will include information on Water, Energy, Food (WEF) and interlinkages with other sectors as Economy, Ecosystems, Society, Climate and Land for delivering a multi-sectoral assessment consistent with socio-economic and climate scenarios. The ONEPlanET modelling approach will integrate Earth Observation data (e.g., Copernicus, ESA or GEOSS), statistical data and information from basins to national and regional, via three representative case studies in the Songwe (Malawi/Tanzania), Inkomati-Usuthu (South Africa) and Niger (Nigeria) river basins, which show different types of basins and socio-ecological systems. ONEPlanET will help to better understand the interactions between Nexus sectors to deliver sound technical and policy recommendations towards the implementation of energy infrastructure to build a more climate neutral and resilient society.
project.title: OpeN source nExus modelling tools for Planning sustainable Energy Transition in Africa
project.keywords: Energy systems, Decisional tools, Nexus, Communities, EU-AU partnership, Water management, Policy Development

article.title: Multi-sector models for Africa’s green future
article.teaser: With a focus on water, energy and food, tailor-made models for a clean energy transition in Africa address socio-economic and technical needs.

category.title: Network, platform, chamber, group of professionals
Results Pack
category.description: Article: Collections of results, from finished or nearly completed projects, focusing on a specific theme that you can apply in your domain

article.title: Africa-EU collaboration
article.teaser: As Europe’s closest neighbour and strategic partner, Africa shares strong ties and mutual interests with the European Union. Their partnership is evolving into a forward-looking alliance addressing critical global challenges such as climate change and clean energy transition in support of resilience, energy access and inclusive green growth on both continents.

result.title: C&D Plan and C&D updates
result.description: The first C&D Plan until M6 will collect the key messages, audiences, and communication tools to be used for the ONEPlanET promotion with stakeholders in Europe and Africa. The second C&D Plan will collect the key messages, audiences, and communication tools to be used for the ONEPlanET promotion with stakeholders in Europe and Africa in the period M6-M12.The third C&D Plan will collect the key messages, audiences, and communication tools to be used for the ONEPlanET promotion with stakeholders in Europe and Africa in the period M12-M24.The forth C&D Plan will collect the key messages, audiences, and communication tools to be used for the ONEPlanET promotion with stakeholders in Europe and Africa in the period M24-M36.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - ONEPlanET (OpeN source nExus modelling tools for Planning sustainable Energy Transition in Africa)
result.teaser: The ONEPlanET project operates within the context of Africa's urgent need for sustainable development, particularly in energy and resource management. Facing challenges like energy poverty, water scarcity, food insecurity, and ecological degradation exacerbated by climate...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Report on co-design of ICT tools
result.description: Report on the co-design of the user experience of the ICT tools (user-friendly web-based tool and Gamification tool) and description of the socio-technological requirements. List of the key user groups including their needs collected during co-design workshops.

result.title: Socioeconomic barriers and gaps for Nexus approach in AU, including Global trade and agreements
result.description: Literature review and policy analysis to identify Africa's socio-economic barriers, opportunities, and gaps related to implanting the water-energy-food nexus.

result.title: Specifications and requirements for Nexus in AU
result.description: The document will constitute a baseline for impact assessment, collecting all the main indicators, specifications and requirements that will affect the WEF Nexus initiative.

result.title: Definition of conceptual cross-sectoral models for Nexus assessment at basin scale and scenario design
result.description: Report about the cross-sectoral methodology and the common Nexus modeling framework. Definition of the Nexus conceptual models (one per each case study - river basin). List of policies selected during workshops involving relevant policy-makers from the Stakeholders Community

result.title: Requirements for upgrading water governance at basin scale and policy catalogue
result.description: Development of policy catalogues with toolboxes on (1) Regulatory and Institutional, (2) Engineering, Technology and Gender (3) Economics and Finance, and (4) Communications.

result.title: ONEPlanET Capacity Building needs and materials
result.description: The report will summarise the capacity building needs in the three pilot locations of the ONEPlanET project taking into account the different stakeholders’ characteristics. It will also include a description of the different training materials that will be design and created during the project.

result.title: Report on the selection of functions and functionalities from previous models
result.description: The report will describe all the identified functions and functionalities that will be integrated in the WEF models.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
